stem: The disaster response nurse is triaging victims at the scene of a train derailment. Based on the documented 'RPM' (Respirations, Perfusion, Mental Status) parameters in the Triage Flowsheet, assign the correct START triage tag to each victim.

tabs.title: Incident Overview
tabs.content:
22:00: Dispatch reports a high-speed passenger train derailment with at least 50 injuries.
22:15: First responder nurse initiates START (Simple Triage and Rapid Treatment) protocol.
22:30: Triage tags are being applied. Resources are prioritized for immediate life-threats.

tabs.title: Triage Flowsheet
tabs.content:
Victim #Respirations (R)Perfusion (P) - Cap RefillMental Status (M)
Victim 101None (Even after airway opened)No radial pulseUnresponsive
Victim 10234/min1.5 secondsFollows simple commands
Victim 10320/min4.0 secondsConfused / Disoriented
Victim 10422/min1.8 secondsAlert / Walking to safe zone

tabs.title: Injury Severity
tabs.content:
Victim 101: Massive crush injury to pelvis; no signs of life.
Victim 102: Severe abdominal pain; 20% burns to legs.
Victim 103: Large scalp laceration with significant active bleeding.
Victim 104: Superficial abrasions; reports 'arm pain'.

rows.text: Victim 101: No respirations, No pulses, Unresponsive
Victim 102: RR 34/min, Cap Refill 1.5s, Follows commands
Victim 104: RR 22/min, Cap Refill 1.8s, Alert, Walking

rationale.correct: Victim 101 is **Black (Expectant)** because there are no respirations even after the airway is opened. Victim 102 is **Red (Immediate)** because RR > 30/min. Victim 103 is **Red (Immediate)** because Capillary Refill > 2 seconds (indicates shock). Victim 104 is **Green (Minor)** because they were able to 'walk to the safe zone' (Walking Wounded).
clinicalPearls: The START algorithm order is: 1. Can they walk? 2. Breathe? 3. Perfusion? 4. Mental Status?
If they can walk, they are GREEN. If they don't breathe after airway tilt, they are BLACK.
If they FAIL any of the RPM (30-2-Can Do), they are RED.

questionTrap.trap: Coding Victim 103 as Yellow because their RR is normal (20/min).
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Always check all three RPM points. Since their Capillary Refill is 4 seconds (P), they are an immediate priority (Red).

mnemonic.title: 30 - 2 - Can Do
mnemonic.expansion: R: RR > 30/min? P: Cap Refill > 2 seconds? M: Can't do commands? Any 'YES' = RED.
